title: Minicamps Get Started, Targeting Rule Gets Clarified, Sorta (Football 06/04)
description:
Adam Aizer and Jamey Eisenberg break down this week's minicamps, including the potentially surprising Chicago Bears, Matt Patricia's first season in Detroit, the Dolphins remaining mediocre, and a pretty captivating offseason for New England. The guys also discuss the NFL's clarification on their new 'targeting' rule  and Hue Jackson's "cleanse" in Lake Erie. 


-CHI: Are they this year's LAR?
-DET: I have my doubts about Matt Patricia. Will they become a running team?
-MIA: They don't seem like they're going to be very good. Are they stuck in mediocrity?
-NE: Interesting offseason for them. Are they just going to be fine once the season starts?
-Targeting rule: Seems more clear now
-Hue Jackson's fairly weak entrance into Lake Erie, CLE outlook.
